{"step_by_step_thinking": "Based on the information provided in the documents, the position and movement of the articular disc of the TMJ is controlled by fibers of the lower head of the lateral pterygoid muscle. Document [28] states that muscle fibers from the superior venter of the lateral pterygoid muscle insert into the disc, indicating a direct force transfer from the muscle to the disc during jaw movement. Therefore, the correct answer is A. Lower head of lateral pterygoid muscle.", "answer_choice": "A"}
